title: The Letters of Robert Burns
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Sir,--Big with the idea of this important day at Friars Carse, I havewatched the elements and skies, in the full persuasion that they wouldannounce it to the astonished world by some phenomena of terrificportent.

title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: As they came in sight of what was apparently a modern mansion instead  of the picturesque old Friars Carse they were in search of, they were so resentful at the many additions and remodelings that they promptly turned their backs upon it.

title: John and Betty's Scotch history visit,
author: Williamson, Margaret. [from old catalog]
snippet: ' ' Friars Carse, the house where the contest of the whistle took place, is not far distant.

title: Our coaching trip,
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: Proceeding next to Dumfries,  the party were kindl}" entertained by Mr. Nelson,  of Friars Carse (Ellisland), where Mr. and Mrs. Carnegie renewed their recollections of our national poet, " Robert Burns."

title: Our coaching trip,
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: What a pretty sight it was to see Miss Nelson bounding along upon her horse in the distance, an avant courier leading us to a warm welcome at her beautiful home ! Would I had been with hqr on Habeebah ! We spent an hour or two there, and then with three enthusiastic cheers for " Friars Carse and a' within it," the Charioteers drove off ; but long must fond recollections of that estate and of the faces seen there linger in our memories  as among the most pleasing of our ever-mem- orable journey.

title: Our coaching trip,
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: Friars Carse is a lovely spot.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Met Grose the antiquary at Friars Carse, and afterwards wrote the humorous poem On Captain Grose's Peregrinations . In December was written the election ballad The Five Carlines.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: October 16, the great bacchanalian contest for the Whistle took place at Friars Carse in presence of the poet.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: On 28th June wrote Verses in Friars Carse Hermitage.

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: Formed the acquaintance of Captain Riddell of Glenriddell, a gentleman of literary and antiquarian tastes, who resided at Friars Carse, within a mile of Ellisland.
